sen.j: 文徳天皇（もんとくてんのう、天長4年（827年） - 天安2年8月27日（858年10月7日）、在位：嘉祥3年4月17日（850年5月31日） - 天安2年8月27日（858年10月7日））は第55代天皇。
sen.e: Emperor MONTOKU (827 - October 7th, 858), his reign was May 31st, 850 - October 7th, 858), who was the 55th Emperor.

sen.j: 承和9年（842年）、承和の変で皇太子恒貞親王が廃されると、変の解決に功のあった伯父藤原良房にも推され代わりに立太子し、嘉祥3年（850年）、仁明天皇の崩御に伴い即位。
sen.e: After Prince Tsunesada was dethroned from being Crown Prince in the Showa Incident in 842, instead the Emperor MONTOKU succeeded to the throne after Emperor NINMYO died (850), with his uncle, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa's recommendation, who contributed to solve the incident.

After Prince Tsunesada was removed from the position of crown prince in the Showa Incident of 842, instead the Emperor Montoku succeeded to the throne after Emperor Ninmyo died (850), with the recommendation of his uncle, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, who had contributed to the resolution of the incident.

After Prince Tsunesada was removed from the position of Crown Prince in the Showa Incident of 842, instead the Emperor Montoku succeeded to the throne after Emperor Nimmyo died (850), with the recommendation of his uncle, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, who had contributed to the resolution of the incident.

sen.j: こうした経緯も含め、藤原良房は仁明朝期頃から次第に権勢を強め、文徳天皇が東宮だった頃に嫁がせていた娘、染殿后藤原明子 (染殿后)（あきらけいこ）がちょうど天皇即位の年にようやく産んだ、第四皇子惟仁親王（のちの清和天皇）を立太子させる。
sen.e: Including above situation, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa started to enhance his political power during Emperor JINMYO's reign, he let his grandchild, his 4th Prince, Prince Korehito (later called Emperor SEIWA) to became Crown Prince, whose mother was Some dono no kisaki(empress) FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko (Empress Some dono) (Akira Keiko), married while the Emperor was Crown Prince, and finally had Prince Korehito on the same year of the Emperor's enthronement.

Given the above situation, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa started to enhance his political power during Emperor Jinmyo's reign; he let his grandchild, his fourth prince, Korehito (later called Emperor Seiwa, whose mother was Some dono no kisaki (Empress) FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko (Empress Some dono) (Akira Keiko) become the crown prince, married while the Emperor was crown prince, and finally had Prince Korehito in the same year of the Emperor's enthronement.

Given the situation, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa started to enhance his political power during Emperor Nimmyo's reign; he let his grandchild, his fourth prince, Korehito (later called Emperor Seiwa), whose mother was Some dono no kisaki (Empress) FUJIWARA no Akirakeiko (Empress Some dono) (Akira Keiko) become the crown prince, married while the Emperor was the crown prince, and finally had Prince Korehito in the same year as the Emperor's enthronement.

sen.j: 天皇は寵愛の更衣、紀静子所生の第一皇子惟喬親王に期待したが、良房の圧力で惟仁を皇太子とせざるを得なかった。
sen.e: The Emperor wished his first Prince, Prince Koretaka, son of his favorite Koi, KI no Shizuko, to succeed the throne, however due to Yoshifusa's political pressure he had no choice but to let Korehito to become Crown Prince.

sen.j: だが、その後も天皇と良房の暗闘は続き、良房の圧力の前に在位中には内裏の外れにある東宮や嵯峨上皇の離宮だった冷然院などに居住して、遂に一度も内裏正殿を居住の間として生活を送ることはなかったという。
sen.e: However the darkness between Emperor MONTOKU and Yoshifusa continued, it is said while Emperor MONTOKU was in power, he moved to live in Togu (palace for a crown prince) located at the end of the Palace, or Reizen-in where ex-Emperor SAGA's Palace far from the the Palace, and he never lived and spent his time in the main building of the Palace because Yoshifusa put political pressure on him.

However, the darkness between Emperor Montoku and Yoshifusa continued, and it is said while Emperor Montoku was in power he moved to the togu (a palace for a crown prince) located at the end of the Palace (or Reizen-in) where the ex-emperor Saga's palace was located far from the Palace; he never lived and spent his time in the main building of the Palace because Yoshifusa had put political pressure on him.

However, the darkness between Emperor Montoku and Yoshifusa continued, and it is said while Emperor Montoku was in power he moved to the togu (a palace for a crown prince) located at the end of the palace, or Reizen-in where the Retired Emperor Saga's palace was located far from the palace; he never lived or spent time in the main building of the palace because Yoshifusa had put political pressure on him.

sen.j: やがて、天皇は惟喬親王の立太子を条件に惟仁親王への譲位を図るが、惟喬親王の身に危機が及ぶ事を恐れた左大臣源信の諫言で取り止めとなった。
sen.e: Soon Emperor tried to let Prince Korehito resign from Crown Prince as he wished Prince Koretaka to become Crown Prince instead, however the Minister of the left, MINAMOTO no Makoto advised to stop it as he was concerned about Prince Koretaka's safety.

Soon the Emperor tried to let Prince Korehito resign from his position as the crown prince, as he wanted Prince Koretaka to become the crown prince instead; however, Minister of the Left MINAMOTO no Makoto, advised that it should be stopped since he was concerned about Prince Koretaka's safety.

Soon the Emperor tried to let Prince Korehito resign from his position as the crown prince, as he wanted Prince Koretaka to become the crown prince instead; however, Sadaijin MINAMOTO no Makoto, advised that it should be stopped since he was concerned about Prince Koretaka's safety.

sen.j: かかる状況下で858年に突然の病で急死する。
sen.e: Due to above situation, the Emperor died suddenly with his illness in 858.

sen.j: 通説では死因は脳卒中とされているが、彦由一太は余りの病状の急変から藤原良房による暗殺説を唱えている。
sen.e: In popular lore his cause of death was called cerebral stroke, however 彦由一太 seemed to think the Emperor was assassinated by FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa after considering the Emperor's illness got worse too suddenly.
